text: Irving Berlin (May 11, 1888 â€“ September 22, 1989), born Israel Baline in Imperial Russia, was a Jewish-American songwriter.Barol, Bill. "Irving Berlin: 1888-1989," Newsweek. October 2, 1989, p. 75; retrieved 2011-12-29. ==Selected works== Berlin's first popular success was "Alexander's Ragtime Band." In 1938, Kate Smith made "God Bless America" a popular hit. In 1942, Berlin won the Academy Award for the best original song in the movie "Holiday Inn". The song was "White Christmas.". Bing Crosby recorded the song. This became "the best-selling record of all time."Harris, Roy J. "Irving Berlin's White Christmas," Wall Street Journal. December 11, 2009; retrieved 2011-12-29.
